intro: Cerinthe glabra var. pirinica, commonly known as the Pirin cerinthe, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae, characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh mountain environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety hair, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
